text.0: heaven and earth trembled at the might and voice of him whom loved and holy one helper of all mankind.
text.1: the wise who longed for spoil in fight for kine brought forth with power a friend mid waters at the sacrifice.
text.2: as these like friends have done this work for you these prompt servants of purumīlha somaofferer.
text.3: give mental power to him who sings the sacred song and hearken strong ones to the master of the house.
text.4: the folk have glorified your birth from earth and heaven to be extolled ye strong ones for your mighty power.
text.5: ye when ye bring to singer and the rite enjoy the sacrifice performed with holy praise and strength.
text.6: the people prospers asuras whom ye dearly love ye righteous ones proclaim aloud the holy law.
text.7: that efficacious power that comes from lofty heaven ye bind unto the work as to the pole an ox.
text.8: on this great earth ye send your treasure down with might unstained by dust the crowding kine are in the stalls.
text.9: here in the neighbourhood they cry unto the sun at morning and at evening like swift birds of prey.
text.10: the flames with curling tresses serve your sacrifice whereto ye sing the song mitra and varuṇa.
text.11: send down of your free will prosper our holy songs ye are sole masters of the singers hymn of praise.
text.12: whoso with sacrifices toiling brings you gifts and worships sage and priest fulfilling your desire.
text.13: to him do ye draw nigh and taste his sacrifice come wellinclined to us unto our songs and prayer.
text.14: with sacrifices and with milk they deck you first ye righteous ones as if through stirrings of the mind.
text.15: to you they bring their hymns with their collected thought while ye with earnest soul come to us gloriously.
text.16: rich strength of life is yours ye heroes have obtained through your surpassing powers rich farextending might.
text.17: not the past days conjoined with nights not rivers not the paṇis have attained your godhead and your wealth.
